dublin_core.dcvalue: Physical activity guidelines recommend engaging in moderate and vigorous intensity physical activity to elicit health benefits Similarly these higher intensity ranges for activity are typically targeted in healthy living interventions ie exercise prescription Comparatively less attention has been focused on changing lower intensity physical activity ie sedentary activity behaviors The purpose of this study was to explore the effects of prescribing changes to physical activity of various intensities ie sedentary through exercise through the primary care setting
Prescribing physical activity through primary care: does activity intensity matter?
